name: Thai Green Curry
author: Alex Persson
ingredients: 500g thinly sliced beef (or steak - freeze for 1 hour and slice)
720g cooked white rice, to serve (3 cups)
2 tsp toasted sesame seeds, to garnish
method: Heat neutral oil in a large skillet over medium high heat, and cook the sliced onions for about 5 minutes, stirring often.

Add the beef and sugar, and cook until the beef is slightly browned. Add the mirin, soy sauce, stock (and sake). Bring to a simmer, and cook for about 10-15 minutes to reduce the stock into a thin sauce. Taste for seasoning, and add a little more soy sauce if needed.

Meanwhile, heat another couple tablespoons of oil in a cast iron or non-stick skillet. Cook the eggs sunny-side up. You can cook them in batches if needed. The yolks should still be runny! Alternatively, poach the eggs for something lighter.

When the beef is done simmering, divide the rice among serving bowls (the original recipe is for 4, so 4 bowls), and top with the beef and an egg for each bowl. Garnish with chopped scallion and toasted sesame seeds, if using.
